alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 5:42PM MST until August 16 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 845 PM MST. * At 540 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from Keams Canyon south past Castle Butte, just east of White Cone and west of Seba Dalkai. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Keams Canyon, Cedar Springs, Dilkon, Tees Toh, Seba Dalkai, Castle Butte, Indian Wells, White Cone, Jeddito, and Jadito. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 402 and 415. State Route 87 between mile markers 356 and 396. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Keams Canyon Wash, Jeddito Wash, Beshbito Wash, Little Colorado River, Polacca Wash, Cottonwood Wash, Bidahochi Wash, Steamboat Wash, Coyote Wash, Blairs Spring Wash, Ha-whi-yalin Wash, Humpy Wash, Tees Toh Wash, Bluebird Canyon Wash, Fern Feather Wash and Pueblo Colorado Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
